item.title: Kubernetes - Basics
item.description: Kubernetes is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling and management of containerized applications that was originally designed by Google and now maintained by the Cloud Native Computing Foundation Kubernetes Components Master Components Master components provide the cluster’s control plane. Master components make global decisions about the cluster (for example, scheduling), and detecting and responding to cluster events kube-apiserver: Component on the master that exposes the Kubernetes API etcd: Consistent and highly-available key value store used as Kubernetes’ backing store for all cluster data.

item.title: Apache htaccess configuration
item.description: Htaccess (HyperText Access) is a configuration file that allows developers to overide the Apache webserver configuration at directory level. Enable .htaccess By default .htaccess is not enable, we have to change in httpd.conf (Apache) configuration file to for enable .htaccess Replace AllowOverride None to AllowOverride All Examples: <Directory /var/www/html/example.com/public_html> Options Indexes FollowSymLinks AllowOverride All Require all granted </Directory> Common Uses of .htaccess Mod_Rewrite Authentication Custom Error Pages Mime Types SSI (Server Side Includes) Mod_Rewrite Mod_rewrite module is use for rule-based rewrite engine, based on Perl Compatible Regular Expressions.

item.title: Docker Intro
item.description: Docker is a container management service. Which basic means upload/install required things in one container and ship to any where. Docker announced in March 2013 and since then it has become a major tool in development world. Docker Release Docker EE (Enterprise Edition) [Paid] Docker CE (Community Edition) [Free] Docker for Cloud Docker Stable and Edge version Edge (Beta) released monthly, Stable quarterly Stable version rolls in three months of Edge features Docker Architecture Docker uses a client-server architecture.

item.title: Shell Script - Examples
item.description: SQL Backup and Push to S3 Bucket In this example we are taking the backup from docker mysql instance and also using awscli tool to push backup sql file to S3 bucket. #!/bin/bash S3_bucketName=my-database-backup DB_Username=root DB_Password=pass DB_Name=testing mysqlIpAddress=$(docker inspect --format '{{ .NetworkSettings.IPAddress }}' mysql-idp-server) filename='my-server-' + $(date +%Y-%m-%d-%H.%M.%S) mysqldump -h $mysqlIpAddress -u$DB_Username -p$DB_Password $DB_Name > $filename.sql #Create bucket aws s3 mb s3://$S3_bucketName aws s3 cp $filename.sql s3://$S3_bucketName/ rm -rf $filename.

item.title: Linux commands
item.description: Basic commands of linux Commands Commands User management Commands Description useradd [USERNAME] Add new user useradd -G [GROUPNAME][username] Add new user in group passwd [USERNAME] User account is locked until you set a password with the passwd command usermod -a -G [GROUPNAME][username] Add user in group userdel [USERNAME] Remove the existing user cat /etc/passwd | sort View username and group information cat /etc/group | sort View linux group usermod -d -m [NEW_DIRECTORY][username] Change the user home directory location usermod -u [UID][username] Change the user UID
